title: Afghanistan: Inside a secret school for girls
description: The classes are a small act of defiance after the Taliban banned most teenage girls from education.

title: Climate change swells odds of record India, Pakistan heatwaves
description: A UK study says record-breaking temperatures in NW India and Pakistan are now 100 times more likely.

title: Ukraine: The police officer who lost his family in one Russian strike
description: Ivan Simoroz's home was hit by Russian bombs, killing six members of his family - days later he returned to work.

title: Måneskin's crazy rise to fame: 'We only slept in our own beds 10 times last year'
description: The Italian rock band relive the highs and lows of becoming a global success after winning Eurovision.

title: China's silenced feminist: How Sophia Huang Xueqin went missing
description: BBC Eye investigates the disappearance of Sophia Huang Xueqin, a high-profile feminist journalist who kick-started China’s #MeToo movement.

title: French Open: Carlos Alcaraz aiming to seize Rafael Nadal's crown at Roland Garros
description: Carlos Alcaraz is seen as "the best player right now" in men's tennis - can he land his first Grand Slam at the French Open?

title: How Gen Z is hooked on cryptocurrency and NFTs
description: A growing number of young people are getting into crypto trading - despite the risks.

title: Mariupol: The 80 days that left a flourishing city in ruins
description: The Ukrainian port which has seen some of the most intense fighting is now under Russian control.

title: Ivan Kuliak: Russian gymnast given one-year ban for wearing pro-war symbol on podium next to Ukrainian
description: Russian gymnast Ivan Kuliak is given a one-year ban for wearing a national war symbol on the podium at an event in Qatar in March.

title: 'Not likely but possible' - Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp on title hopes
description: Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp says the title is "not likely but possible" after their 2-1 win at Southampton sends it down to the final day.

title: Charles and Camilla visit Canada on royal tour to mark Platinum Jubilee
description: The Prince of Wales says he will listen on the issue of the treatment of the indigenous community.

title: The post-Brexit battle about borders rumbles on
description: The government "got Brexit done" by agreeing the Northern Ireland Protocol, but the row around it isn't over.

title: Ukraine round-up: Beauty blogger row and UK sweets to refugees

title: Amber Heard denies striking Johnny Depp and doctoring photos
description: Johnny Depp's lawyer has accused Ms Heard of being "the jealous one" in the ex-couple's marriage.

title: Mariupol: Key moments in the siege of the city
description: As Ukrainian fighters are evacuated from the Azovstal steelworks, how Russia has closed in on the city.

title: Ed Sheeran surprises Suffolk school with video message
description: The singer thanks a primary school that named one of its classes after him.

title: Buffalo shooting: Parents of injured victim demand political action
description: The parents of one Buffalo victim want to know what's being done to prevent another mass shooting.

title: Australia election: A simple guide
description: Australians go to the polls on 21 May, for the country's first election since 2019.

title: Retired colonel speaks out on Russian TV
description: Mikhail Khodarenok gives a rare insight saying the military operation in Ukraine can only get worse.

title: Knaresborough litter-pick pair's car trip with live WWI bomb
description: The couple originally thought the device, found in the river in Knaresborough, was a gas cannister.

title: Queen shown how to use Oyster card on Elizabeth line
description: The monarch made a surprise visit to Paddington station, ahead of the opening of the much delayed train line.

title: Aberystwyth: Rude plaque for man who hated seagulls removed
description: Huw Davies seemingly loved the views of Cardigan Bay, but not the birds who were there as well.

title: Eintracht Frankfurt v Rangers: 'Everest beckons as miraculous European adventure reaches climax'
description: Rangers have climbed from the troughs of Scotland's fourth tier to the summit of Europe as they prepare for an historic final, writes Tom English.

title: Buffalo shooting: How far-right killers are radicalised online
description: A movement of online extremists targets innocent people in shooting rampages that follow a similar blueprint.

title: Georgia Stanway joins Bayern Munich after leaving Manchester City
description: Former Manchester City midfielder Georgia Stanway signs for Bayern Munich on a three-year deal.

title: National Action: Nazi Alex Davies guilty of fascist group membership
description: During his trial, Alex Davies was described as "probably the biggest Nazi of the lot".

title: Elizabeth line: Queen makes surprise visit to Paddington Station
description: Buckingham Palace says the visit, ahead of the line's opening on 24 May, is a "happy development".

title: Team GB's Charley Davison on motherhood, comeback and Olympics
description: Team GB boxer and mother-of-three Charley Davison shares her remarkable story of taking a seven-year break from the sport to eyeing a second Olympics.

title: Runner loses wedding ring during a 100k Jurassic Coast race
description: Jonathan Haynes believes the wedding ring slipped off his finger during a fall at West Bay cliffs.

title: Job vacancies outpace unemployment for first time
description: The unemployment rate falls to its lowest level for nearly 50 years between January and March.

title: Rochdale dog attack: Man arrested after boy, 3, dies
description: A 48-year-old man is arrested over a dog attack which killed a young boy in Rochdale.

title: Warning poorest households are struggling to get £150 energy rebate

title: Wayne Rooney says FA wanted Rebekah Vardy to calm down
description: The ex-footballer gave evidence on day six of his wife Coleen's libel case brought by Rebekah Vardy.

description: The deal to buy Twitter can't "move forward" without proof of spam account numbers, Mr Musk says.

description: School caterers will have to shrink portions or use cheaper ingredients, a major food wholesaler warns.

description: Dan hosted his final edition of BBC Breakfast this morning, six years after joining the programme.

title: Kay Mellor: Actress and Fat Friends creator dies aged 71
description: She was well known for writing and creating the ITV series Fat Friends, which starred James Corden.

description: England and Wales Cricket Board chief executive Tom Harrison will step down in June.

description: MI5 backs a new app to help people spot online approaches by foreign spies in disguise.

title: Turkey threatens to block Finland and Sweden Nato bids
description: Turkish President Erdogan accused the Nordic nations of harbouring terrorists wanted by Ankara.

title: Colombian robbery victim crashes car into thieves
description: The thieves stole a watch and mobile phone before the victim drove into them in his convertible.

title: The 'village' that got me off drink and drugs

title: NFHS-5: India's preference for sons over daughters remains
